Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortably unkept but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Johnniego
Reviews.Content: I spend more time in hotels than I do at home with my job currently. This hotel was just cheap though. The room did smell clean, and housekeeping was doing their job, but the walls had small holes in them and the furniture had signs of wear that made you have to think about all the previous guest who were staying there and just made me feel uncomfortable. Bathroom The bathroom towels were thin and hard, the ceiling over the shower was crumbling, and the shower head was covered in calcium build up. Bed Overall comfortable but with thin pillows and old pink blanket that needed to be replaced. The headboard was covered in nicks and chips. Amenities Fast Internet, fridge and microwave!

Reviews.Title: “Sub par experience.”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotravelgirl02
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotel stays I have ever experienced. As I walked into the lobby I noticed that water was dripping from the ceiling (if it wasn't late and i was desperate, I should have taken it as a sign to leave right then!). The person on duty shrugged it off like it was nothing. My room itself smelled of mold and like it hadn't been cleaned in a long, long time. The comforter was raggedy and the wool blanket was pilled and smelled terrible. The carpet in the room seemed like it had not been vacuumed in a while, and I didn't dare go barefoot. Finally, the bathroom was gross. The shower had hair in the drain, the towels looked like they had been around for to many years, and the soap bar wrapper had already been opened. All in all, this place should be checked by the state to ensure that it meets the basic standards.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!”
Reviews.Author: donna s
Reviews.Content: Due to unfortunate circumstances, I found myself needing an extended place to live until mine was available. I had no prolem getting a room, my room has always been clean and comfortable and I can trust the people that work there. The people running the front desk are all very nice and knowlegeable, (if not they find the answer by the next day). When my circumstances change I will miss the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 Indy South”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: My job requires that I stay in a lot of hotels and they must be economical. I have found for the money that this hotel is a terrific value. The rooms are always clean and spacious. A warm breakfast is offered every morning and the hotel is geographically ideal for the area. As for the staff you are always greeted with a smile and a willingness to serve your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: HonestK1610
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at nice Super8 hotels but this is not one of them. Other than the employees (who were uniformly friendly and helpful), everything felt chintzy. The breakfast selection was poor: no non-sugared cereals, no juice (it was orange drink), no fruit, no yogurt, no eggs, no peanut butter, no cheese, no cream cheese - no elements of a healthy meal that are commonly found in this type of breakfast. It would have been nice to have had two bedside lamps (one of ours plugged in right behind the mattress and wouldn't stay on), four pillows (there were three for two people - who gets the extra one?), decent bath towels (not plush, just ordinary would have been nice), and a hair dryer that would stay on (circuit protector kept blowing). I'll definitely stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: turkey99
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel. It was absolutely filthy. We tried twice to turn the furnace on and both times it set off the smoke alarm. The odor was terrible. No one ever buzzed our room about this, we just reset the smoke alarm. We went downstairs to eat breakfast one morning and it was horrible. We never went down again. The electrical system is unsafe. The plug-ins are not secured in metal "boxes" because when you plugged something in, the wall moved. The towel racks were hanging off the walls. The towels were threadbare. The shower alternated between hot and cold water. I didn't expect the Ritz, for for $90 a night I did expect clean. Please, I urge you to NOT stay at this hotel. It is pitiful. I have sent a comment to Super 8 as well.

Reviews.Title: “Could use improvements in all areas”
Reviews.Author: grumpyky
Reviews.Content: smoke smell in room, shower and sink needs repair, no water presure,air cond. very noisy. TV color very bold could not adjust.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: rtsb
Reviews.Content: Every thing was great the only complaint I would have is the ceiling starting to break apart in the bathroom right above my head in the shower.And I didnt like the big window being so close to the ground that you look out of kinda eary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Colts Game”
Reviews.Author: j_traveler067
Reviews.Content: We went to see the Denver Game and wanted a place outside the downtown area. This place is 4 miles south of the Stadium with a Road that leads you right to the Stadium. The place was perfect for us and had all the basic amenities Basic Cable with HBO, Wireless, a small workout room and very important a Business center with a printer for us to print out our tickets. Their breakfast was also good with Waffles and Biscuits gravy. Overall the staff was American and Great.

Reviews.Title: “Needs remodel, but good on the budget”
Reviews.Author: mkm1013
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. The rate was cheap - $49/night. The room are old and dated, but clean. Lots of work crews staying here. The location is great. It's 15-20 minutes from airport and downtown depending on traffic. There are a variety of good restaurants and shopping within five miles. We were In town for a convention and didn't want to pay $150-200/night for a downtown hotel. All day garage parking was $12-$18. So we saved the cost of our meals and vehicle but going cheap for the week.

Reviews.Title: “decent, but won't go back”
Reviews.Author: chris4740
Reviews.Content: The continental breakfast was not good. No fruit, no bagels...only waffles (batter was spoiled this morning) and biscuits and gravy. The biscuits could have been used as hockey pucks. I couldn't even tear them. My room was supposed to be non-smoking, but obviously the maid smoked in my room while cleaning, because both days when I came back to the room, it reeked of cigarette smoke and there was even ashes in the ashtray, and on the top of my laptop. Otherwise, it was cheap and close to both places I had to be at while in Indy. The bed was very comfortable, however, u needed 2 pillows to make it thick enough. There are too many nearby hotels with similar prices for me to settle with this one again. Next year, I'll be staying somewhere else. On a side note, if you are ever in Indianapolis, be sure to visit Calvary Tabernacle on Fletcher Ave. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: dk2007
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed there during a convention in August 2007. We had 2 rooms and Super 8 customer service was very helpful in making sure we had adjoining rooms. The staff at the hotel was very professional and friendly. They were able to answer our many questions and gave helpful suggestions. Their shuttle service made it easy for our late-waking friend to join us at the convention. The breakfast was great, we ate in the morning and didn't feel hungry until late afternoon, not bad for 3 large-sized guys! The rooms and beds were clean and comfortable. I only have 2 complaints: 1) The bathroom. Like others have said, the bathrooms need to be re-vamped. The low-flow toilet was...unexpected. 2) The ice machines. When we stayed there, the upstairs machine was broken and the one downstairs was usually empty. Luckily, there's a Wal Mart & Target nearby, so no loss to us. Overall, a nice, quiet place to stay. Will definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Not first choice”
Reviews.Author: mccoolfam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK if you can't find a room somewhere else. Overall the experience was fine. The rooms were clean but were in need of a deeper cleaning. The beds were comfortable and the linens were clean and not worn. Everything worked properly. The bathroom was clean but needed a little maintenance; some caulking around the tub was loose, for instance. There was no coffee for the coffee-maker. The room included a fridge and microwave. The hotel was quiet on a Saturday night . The front desk staff were very friendly and check-in and out was swift. (pre-paid through Expedia). The free breakfast was good and well-stocked, including a waffle machine. Overall it seemed the staff did a good job of keeping the place clean and operational, but it is in need of a remodel and/or deep cleaning. I would stay there again but only if I couldn't find a higher end hotel somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, good hotel for the rate”
Reviews.Author: gatorcard83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Brickyard weekend and for the rate we got ($53.10) it was a very good deal. The staff was very nice, housekeeping did a good job with the room, and the room and hotel itself were in very good shape. Hotel breakfast was pretty basic but still good. Finally, while we never used the pool, it looked pretty nice as well. I only have one major and one minor complaint about this hotel. The minor complaint is that their TV's have very few channels beyond local channels, I think I counted like 12 channels. The major complaint was that the water pressure in the shower was an absolute joke, it wasn't very good at all. Other than those things though everything else was fine. If you're looking for a good hotel in Indy at a fairly cheap rate you can't go wrong here.

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 Indianapolis South
HotelInfo.Address: 450 Bixler Road, I-465 Exit 2B, Indianapolis, IN 46227
